movie_title: Keeping kids off smartphones ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Can you stop your child having a phone if all their friends have one? For audio and transcript downl

vocabulary.definition: physically and mentally dependent on a particular substance or behavior
vocabulary.example: She is addicted to her smartphone, spending hours on social media every day.

vocabulary.definition: feeling worried, nervous, or uneasy about something with an uncertain outcome
vocabulary.example: The upcoming exam made him feel anxious and stressed.

vocabulary.definition: made to happen at a later time than originally planned or expected
vocabulary.example: The delayed flight caused passengers to miss their connecting flights.

vocabulary.definition: causing someone to feel isolated or estranged from others
vocabulary.example: Her strict rules were alienating her from her friends.

vocabulary.definition: a group of people with shared interests or activities
vocabulary.example: The book club formed a close circle of friends who met every week to discuss novels.

vocabulary.definition: giving special importance or significance to something
vocabulary.example: By raising his voice, he was emphasising the urgency of the situation.
